children.string: [The Antidote to Celebrity Church Is Mere Church](https://www.christianitytoday.com/ct/2021/november/celebrity-church-mere-church-mars-hill-mark-driscoll.html) #[[church/theology]] #[[inoreader]]
Written by:: Chanelle Nibbelink, for [[Christianity Today]]

Excerpt:: Chris Rock once shared in an interview how he develops new standup material. Like many established comedians, he shows up at small comedy clubs and gets on stage with five or ten minutes worth of jokes, developing one or two at a time and stitching what works into his next tour or special.

[I Can’t Quit My Evangelical Heritage. Neither Can You.](https://www.christianitytoday.com/ct/2021/november-web-only/exvangelicals-evangelicalism-doubt-faith-heritage-cant-quit.html) #[[church/theology]] #[[inoreader]]
Written by:: Mallory Rentsch, for [[Christianity Today]]

Excerpt:: Like many of my peers, I am a child of American evangelicalism. I was born to professing parents, made my own public statement of faith at five, and was baptized a few years later—still so tiny that my pastor had to lift me up to reach the microphone.
Excerpt:: IN 1995, Bob Sabath, then-administrator of Sojourners’ new website, wrote about how the World Wide Web might expand and change faith communities.
Excerpt:: AS WE APPROACH the new year, the more fortunate among us will be taking time to organize their lives by rebalancing their financial portfolios and considering new investments.
